learning_outcomes.description: Design a simple experiment complying with the required accuracy of the measurements.
Apply statistical methods to data analysis.
Apply a number of commonly used experimental techniques including modern based-on-computer technologies.
Write professional scientific reports and use laboratory notebooks to keep clear records and protect intellectual property.
Work independently on an extended, open-ended project.

assessments.due_date: Report for a Module is due every 3 weeks. The order of Modules varies for each student.
assessments.task_description: Report on Advanced Spectroscopy
assessments.submission_guidelines: Report should be submitted electronically (as a PDF file) through the link in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Hands-on activity

The following activities will be scheduled during the semester. A specific timetable will be determined for each student and depends on the enrolment and availability of facilities at the Centre of Microscopy and Microanalysis (CMM) and Australian National Fabrication Facility (ANFF-Q)

Module 1: Microfabrication and Advanced Imaging
- Electron microscopy and other super resolution (down to atomic level) imaging techniques
- Micro-fabrication (photolithography)

Module 2: Advanced Spectroscopy
- Raman Spectroscopy
- High resolution Diode Spectroscopy

Module 3: Computer Control and Electronics
- Basic of Electronics
- LabView

Module 4: Quantum Technology
- Superconducting Quantum Interference Device (SQUID)
- HeNe laser


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Hands-on activity The following activities will be scheduled during the semester. A specific timetable will be determined for each student and depends on the enrolment and availability of facilities at the Centre of Microscopy and Microanalysis (CMM) and Australian National Fabrication Facility (ANFF-Q) Module 1: Microfabrication and Advanced Imaging - Electron microscopy and other super resolution (down to atomic level) imaging techniques - Micro-fabrication (photolithography) Module 2: Advanced Spectroscopy - Raman Spectroscopy - High resolution Diode Spectroscopy Module 3: Computer Control and Electronics - Basic of Electronics - LabView Module 4: Quantum Technology - Superconducting Quantum Interference Device (SQUID) - HeNe laser
